definition: good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: They are round and so they bring us good luck all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 它們都是圓的，能給我們帶來一年的好運氣。

sentences.english: On the way home, several passersby wished me well.
sentences.chinese: 回去的路上，幾個路過的人祝我好運。

sentences.english: You say you could ask for the cat's help, but she is actually bringing luck to us, " Wakayama Electric spokeswoman Keiko Yamaki said.
sentences.chinese: 說是讓貓來幫忙，但其實是她給我們帶來了好運。
走好運與倒黴交替發生。

sentences.english: For good luck before taking a test, students may visit a shrine of the Learning god.
sentences.chinese: 考試前求好運，學生可以拜訪文昌帝君聖祠。

sentences.english: Dream nosegay , mean to have to get, the ability on good terms luck.
sentences.chinese: 夢見花束，意味着有所獲，能交好運。

sentences.english: Cole has reason to suppose his luck has turned.
sentences.chinese: 喬科爾有理由相信他的好運將會來臨。

sentences.english: Seeking good fortune at the Che Kung Festival Fair.
sentences.chinese: 市民在車公誕市場選購風車祈求好運。

sentences.english: I am thankful for my good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 我爲自己的好運道心存感激之情。

sentences.english: The luck you see mid-month could also be related to an ex-spouse.
sentences.chinese: 月中的好運也可能跟你以前的配偶有關。

sentences.english: I am lucky to have colleagues who likes to eat as much as I do.
sentences.chinese: 非常好運地可以和一班鐘意食嘢嘅同事一齊。

sentences.english: With regards to his legal battle with Datuk Seri Tiong, I can only wish him good luck.
sentences.chinese: 至於和張慶信的交戰，我唯有祝他好運。

sentences.english: And wish our dear Jacky Xue good luck and great success in the coming New Year.
sentences.chinese: 也祝親愛的謙謙好運常在，並取得更大的成就。

sentences.english: There are many theories of the origin of this superstition of wishing luck to the actors, but here are a few
sentences.chinese: 關於祝演員好運帶來不吉的迷信的起源有很多說法。

sentences.english: It is said that mehndi brings good fortune to a person's life.
sentences.chinese: 據說“曼海蒂”能給人們的生活帶來好運。

sentences.english: For the first few minutes the animals could hardly believe in their good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 開始的幾分鐘裏，動物們還不敢相信他們有如此好運。

definition: to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
original poster (in an online forum)/landlord of a building (traditional)
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
